dfischer.utils

Class HttpLoadTestUserContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • dfischer.utils.HttpLoadTestUserContext

  • public class HttpLoadTestUserContext
extends java.lang.Object
    A context for a simulated user of a load test program.
    Since:
    Proxy Sniffer V5.2-O
    See Also:
    HttpLoadTest

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HttpLoadTestUserContext(java.lang.Object loadTestInstance, java.lang.Thread loadTestThread)
      Create a new instance.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      long getDecrementEndOfLoopPointInTime()
      Get the point in time after the user will be decremented at end of loop.
      java.lang.Object getLoadTestInstance()
      Get the load test instance of the simulated user.
      java.lang.Thread getLoadTestThread()
      Get the load test thread of the simulated user
      boolean isLoadTestUserFinallyEnded()
      Get if the simulated user has finally done all of its work - so it's also an inactive user which cannot be re-activated.
      void setDecrementEndOfLoopPointInTime(long decrementEndOfLoopPointInTime)
      Set the point in time after the user will be decremented at end of loop.
      void setLoadTestInstance(java.lang.Object loadTestInstance)
      Set the load test instance of the simulated user.
      void setLoadTestThread(java.lang.Thread loadTestThread)
      Set the load test thread of the simulated user.
      void setLoadTestUserExecutionPlanPlaceholder()
      Mark that the simulated user is a placeholder used for execution plans (only) in order that later the number of simulated users can be increased at runtime during the load test.
      void setLoadTestUserFinallyEnded()
      Mark that the simulated user has finally done all of its work.

        public HttpLoadTestUserContext(java.lang.Object loadTestInstance,
                       java.lang.Thread loadTestThread)
        Create a new instance. Note: It's also allowed to pass null for any parameter.
        Parameters:
        loadTestInstance - the load test instance of the simulated user
        loadTestThread - the load test thread of the simulated user

    • Method Detail

      • getLoadTestInstance

        public java.lang.Object getLoadTestInstance()
        Get the load test instance of the simulated user.
        Returns:
        the load test instance of the simulated user, or null if no such data is available

      • setLoadTestInstance

        public void setLoadTestInstance(java.lang.Object loadTestInstance)
        Set the load test instance of the simulated user.
        Parameters:
        loadTestInstance - the load test instance of the simulated user. Note: It's also allowed to pass null.

      • getLoadTestThread

        public java.lang.Thread getLoadTestThread()
        Get the load test thread of the simulated user
        Returns:
        the load test thread of the simulated user, or null if no such data is available

      • setLoadTestThread

        public void setLoadTestThread(java.lang.Thread loadTestThread)
        Set the load test thread of the simulated user. Note: It's also allowed to pass null.
        Parameters:
        loadTestThread - the load test thread of the simulated user

      • setDecrementEndOfLoopPointInTime

        public void setDecrementEndOfLoopPointInTime(long decrementEndOfLoopPointInTime)
        Set the point in time after the user will be decremented at end of loop.
        Parameters:
        decrementEndOfLoopPointInTime - the point in time after the user will be decremented at end of loop (millisecond since January 1, 1970), or pass -1 to set an invalid time
        Since:
        V5.5-D

      • getDecrementEndOfLoopPointInTime

        public long getDecrementEndOfLoopPointInTime()
        Get the point in time after the user will be decremented at end of loop.
        Returns:
        the point in time after the user will be decremented at end of loop, or a value <= 0 means invalid time
        Since:
        V5.5-D

      • setLoadTestUserFinallyEnded

        public void setLoadTestUserFinallyEnded()
        Mark that the simulated user has finally done all of its work. This means that the reference to the load test instance and to the load test thread is set to null. The simulated user is marked as finally ended - in order that it can be counted as an inactive user.
        Since:
        V5.2-T
        See Also:
        isLoadTestUserFinallyEnded()

      • setLoadTestUserExecutionPlanPlaceholder

        public void setLoadTestUserExecutionPlanPlaceholder()
        Mark that the simulated user is a placeholder used for execution plans (only) in order that later the number of simulated users can be increased at runtime during the load test.
        Since:
        V5.5-D

      • isLoadTestUserFinallyEnded

        public boolean isLoadTestUserFinallyEnded()
        Get if the simulated user has finally done all of its work - so it's also an inactive user which cannot be re-activated.
        Returns:
        true if the simulated user has finally done all of its work
        Since:
        V5.2-T
